attributes.action: Call for an immediate general election
attributes.additional_details:
An event of this magnitude can not be left to an unelected prime minister of a divided and discredited party and their right wing allies.

A general election would be better than a second referendum since the question would be essentially the same though probably offering a second referendum.

And if leave it must be at least it will be a government elected to that purpose rather than a bunch of self serving plutocrats who are scrambling to save their carreers and legacies.
attributes.background:
The British governments failure to secure Britains future in Europe combined with David Cameron's resignation has led to them having a complete lack of legitimacy and no mandate to negotiate on.

This is far too big to be left to the clowns and ghouls.
